title: Safe Command Documentation with Multiple Echo Commands
content: Technique for documenting shell commands in markdown by using sequential echo commands instead of heredocs to avoid premature code block termination.
description: When heredocs fail due to markdown parsing issues, use multiple echo commands to build files line by line.
problemSolved: Markdown code blocks break when heredoc content contains special characters (triple backticks, indented markers) that interfere with parsing.

whenToUse: When heredoc fails due to markdown parsing
When you need precise control over each line
When working with AI assistants that struggle with heredocs

steps: Start with > to create/overwrite: echo "first line" > file.txt
Use >> for subsequent lines: echo "second line" >> file.txt
Escape special characters: echo "Content with \\\`\\\`\\\`" >> file.md

validation: Commands execute without syntax errors and create the intended file content
